title: Ticket #661: DAGMan can be used for NON-dependent jobs
description: Alex Alas on condor-users (July 24, 2009) suggests that we explicitly discuss that DAGMan can be used for job throttling, and is not only for implementing sets of jobs that are described by a DAG.
remarks:
2009-Aug-12 11:52:02 by psilord:
This concept bothers me. Shouldn't the schedd be able to control how and when jobs are started--that being the function of the schedd? How is this throttling feature set of dagman a super set of the schedd and should that super set be subsumed into the schedd?

2010-Mar-24 14:59:35 by smoler:
Current plan: introduce a new subsection of FAQs that address issues for users dealing with really big jobs/computations/parameter sweeps/etc. Then, answers to questions can be placed directly in the FAQ, or in this ticket's case, include a link to a subsection within the DAGMan section which addresses this issue.

2010-Jul-26 10:59:28 by smoler:
New prose is completed and in the 7.4.3 (and 7.5.3) and future releases.
